$interpreted: Bodyguard: ... Miss Sharice Carterwell?
Sharice: Who the heck are you? You folks look suspicious-AF.
Bodyguard: Sorry for the intrusion, but we would like you to come with us.

Sharice: Do you think I'm that stupid?
I know nothing about you lot; why would I blindly follow you weirdos!
Bodyguard: You're mistaken. Please, there's a reason for this. Let us explain...
Sharice: Shut your piehole, old geezer! Can't you see that I'm in a really ****ty mood right now? Wise up and quit annoying me!!
Bodyguard: Wait up, Miss Sharice. We really don't mean to cause any harm!
Sharice: Blah blah blah~ Sounds like what every bad guy says before they blow everything up!
Bodyguard: I am telling the truth! Please, read this letter and you'll know what we are talking about!
Sharice: ... This is... my father's handwriting?

Bodyguard: YES!! We're here by the request of Mr. Carterwell. 
He wants us to ask you to pay a visit back to the Carterwell household.
Sharice: If you are my father's servant, why didn't you tell me earlier? If you did, I wouldn't have to waste time pummeling you folks.
Bodyguard: I was trying to, but you had no intention of listening...
Sharice: Whatever, don't have time to fuss over the details.
Sharice: Hmph, doesn't he already have my brother to replace me? Tell my father, no way in a billion years will I ever return to that damn house again!
Bodyguard: Please wait!
Sharice: Did you not hear me when I said I was in a bad mood? Do you really want to get your butts kicked again?
Bodyguard: Aren't you even a bit curious about the reason why he asked you to come home?
Sharice: Not one bit! That's none of my business!!
Bodyguard: Mr. Carterwell has predicted that you won't just do what he said. That's why he wrote this letter. Please at least read this letter before you go.
Sharice: ... You're one persistent geezer, aren't you? Fine, I'll read it.
Sharice: Are you screwing with me? This letter... I can't open it though?
Bodyguard: Crap, the rune is damaged...
Sharice: The heck? What rune?
Bodyguard: Mr. Carterwell didn't want outsiders to see the content of the letter. Therefore, he used a rune to seal the envelope.
Bodyguard: Only Miss Sharice can open this envelope.
Sharice: Hmph... Same old father, more concerned about saving face than anything else.
Sharice: My guess is that the rune was damaged when I was beating you guys up.
Bodyguard: I believe that's the case...
Sharice: Hey, do you know what's written in the letter?
Bodyguard: Unfortunately, no. We've never read it...

Sharice: ... Damnit.
Seems like I have no choice but to return to camp and find a rune sorcerer to fix it.
